reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelling through Spain on 5 day tickets, we had booked here as a 2 night stay in a standard room. On arrival, we parked under the sheltered car park, entered the reception and were warmly welcomed. We asked if there were any rooms with a balcony & a full view of Toledo. We were told that there were and the total additional cost was 130€, which we were happy to pay. On entering the (lovely) room and opening the doors to the balcony - wow, magnificent! We both agreed that the extra cost was worth every penny (sorry, cent). At all times of day & night, it was so easy to sit on the balcony and drink in the history - absolutely stunning!
reviews.title: One of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, the rest of the Parador:
reviews.title: Wow! What a view...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and cheerful.
reviews.title: Peace and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The swimming pool clean and welcoming.
reviews.title: A place to relax and enjoy the views

reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant on the first night - delicious!
reviews.title: Great stay with great views

reviews.text: Lovely hotel with incredible views of the historical city of Toledo. The rooms were spacious, clean, and nicely decorated. The bathroom was large with a nice soaking tub and separate toilet room. The only negatives would be the lack of the offering of coffee/tea kettle in the room. In addition, there was a very strong fragrance order. Otherwise we enjoyed 2 wonderful days at the Parador de Toledo.
reviews.title: Breathtaking Views

reviews.text: Stunning views with a wonderful patio to dine on and enjoy beautiful Toledo. Family oriented and quiet. You'll need to take taxis to town but we like staying up on the hill. Breakfast very food and we had a nice dinner too. The pool is very big and that was a plus. Liked the room and the small deck also had the great view.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been intermittent visitors to Paradors over the years and it's an interesting question whether they have moved with the times in terms of service dynamism and facilities. There is a suspicion they live on their fantastic buildings and locations. Whatever else you might say about the Toledo Parador its location is incomparable and the building fits it appropriately. The hotel sits high above the loop in the Tagus which circles around the old city of Toledo. From the hotel you have a theatrical panorama which takes in the whole city with its key buildings, the Alcazar and Cathedral dominating. So perfect is the view that the hotel has a steady stream of casual visitors who sit with a drink on the terrace and a camera in hand with the view in front of them. Indeed when we arrived late on a Saturday afternoon there were so many people there that the substantial car park was completely full.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location.
The best view on Toledo!
reviews.text: However although we enjoyed the location we were staying in the hotel and therefore took a view about service and facilities. Our very generously proportioned room with its sizeable and well equipped bathroom overlooked the quite large swimming pool and its grass surrounds with half the city obliquely visible in the background. We were at one end of building so I guess there would be some rooms with a more direct and panoramic view of the city but ours was good enough, helped by the existence of a balcony complete with chairs and table. The accommodation areas in the hotel are quiet and discreet and with a decent bed we slept well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The public areas other than the terrace which was busy had a slightly impersonal quality which was encouraged by the slightly low key presence of staff. The whole place lacked the vibrancy you find in many modern hotels; there was a stately and perhaps old style quality about the place. That said the staff were helpful when needed and I certainly wouldn't suggest we had an unsatisfactory experience. The buffet breakfast was generous and of a decent quality.
reviews.title: Luxury with a traditional feel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Parador de Tourism – Toledo. It was my second visit to Toledo. The first was a day trip, but we stopped at the Parador for a coffee. It was my wife’s first trip.
reviews.title: What is the meaning of <<Servicio>>?

reviews.text: After a small struggle with signs, we found the Parador. (Not the fault of the Parador!) We were greeted by an English-speaking receptionist, sort of. There was a problem, never explained, with registering my passport. He asked for it three times! Finally we were registered and given a key.
reviews.title: Amazing place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I asked for assistance with our luggage, another receptionist looked at me as if I had just arrived from Mars. Finally, he went to the car and struggled to carry two suitcases and two hanging bags. (We were traveling for several weeks in different climates.) There are no luggage carts at the Parador.
reviews.title: Good Hotel with Excellent City Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was quite spacious with a terrace that overlooked the old city of Toledo. A magical view at all times of the day into the night. When my wife went onto the terrace she found a groove in the tiles filled with cigarette butts. (The Parador is supposed to be entirely non-smoking.) She called reception and a lovely lady cleaned out about 20 butts.
reviews.title: Lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were hungry, so went onto the terrace to have lunch. We sat at a table and waited. Finally, I walked inside to the bar and found a waitress chatting with a colleague. I asked for a menu which arrive in due time. She took longer to arrive to take our order. The food took even longer.
reviews.title: Wonderful views of the old city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the view is undeniable our one night stay was ruined by the staff of this hotel who were disinterested, unfriendly and unyielding. We stayed in this hotel celebrating our wedding anniversary (which we told the staff) and were frustrated from the moment we arrived being told that it was not possible to reserve a well located table to eat at 9pm instead of 8.30pm and that we have to herd into the restaurant with everyone else to fight for our chosen table at 8.30pm, the rooms all have twin beds as far as I'm aware or you can pay an extra 90euro for a 'deluxe' room which apparently has a double bed. Our safe wasn't working and the reception staff ordered a taxi for us to go into Toledo which then had to wait 15mins while the hotel handy man tried (and failed) to fix the safe, meantime our taxi clocked up money on the meter...our meal at the restaurant was average and we felt rushed, the main course came out cold and we had to send it back with no apology. Overall, I would not at all recommend this hotel, I found the staff to be unyielding and not at all interested in making our stay pleasant as stated in the brochure in our room.
reviews.title: Amazing view, terrible hotel experience

reviews.text: We stayed in this parador in high summer. What a retreat. Beautiful location, wonderful beds and rooms and very friendly staff that could not have been nicer or more helpful. Lovely pool too which was a welcome cool off the bar and restaurant shares the same spectacular view as the rooms. A very special place
reviews.title: Wow what a view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit to the Parador de Toledo.As good as any we have stayed in.The extra price for rooms with the view of Toledo is worth every cent which allows you to sit and soak up the tremendous vista of Toledo in its entirety.Good service and quality food - not always the case in Paradors - adds to the pleasant atmosphere. One small niggle - if you fancy a drink on the main terrace overlooking Toledo get there early as day visitors swamp the area to take pictures and drink in the view.
reviews.title: One of the best

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights everything and more than we expected, very warm welcome, rooms spacious with breath taking views down to the beautiful town of Toledo. Drinks on the terrace at sunset is a must just soak up the atmosphere and enjoy. Breakfast was good and plentiful and yet another amazing view......the pool was very inviting after mornings of sightseeing, fresh towels, plenty of sun loungers and space to chill out, outstanding service from the pool attendant......if visiting Toledo staying here is a must.........our only regret....we had to leave
reviews.title: Amazing Wow Factor
A must visit . . .
reviews.text: Even if you don't stay here and take in the amazing view of Toledo, go for a drink or dinner and take in the view. This is an outstanding hotel with great food and impeccable service. You will need a car to get there unless you are up for a hike. That said, the view was the best of our tour of Spain.
